intro: Diosma pinifolia, commonly known as the needleleaf diosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Diosma pinifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
